title: Affordable and Clean Energy
summary: Access to affordable, clean energy is crucial for development and
environmental sustainability. By expanding renewable energy sources like
solar and wind, and improving energy efficiency, we can reduce reliance
on fossil fuels, lower emissions, and ensure that energy is available to
all communities, especially in underserved regions.
stats: 675 million people still live without electricity, with 4 in 5 of them in Sub-Saharan Africa (as of 2021)
Energy efficiency improvement must more than double its pace: Between 2015 and 2020, the annual energy intensity improvement rate was 1.4%. From 2020 to 2025, it needs to increase to 3.4%
International public financing for clean energy in developing countries is declining: In 2017: $28.4 billion. By 2021: Decreased to $10.8 billion
If current trends continue, 1 in 4 people will still rely on unsafe and inefficient cooking systems by 2030
28.2% of electricity is from modern renewables
